speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: There is an ancient Indian saying that something lives only as long as the last person who remembers it. My people have come to trust memory over history. Memory, like fire, is radiant and immutable while history serves only those who seek to control it, those who douse the flame of memory in order to put out the dangerous fire of truth. Beware these men for they are dangerous themselves and unwise. Their false history is written in the blood of those who might remember and of those who seek the truth.

speaker: SOLDIER #1
line: Go!

speaker: SOLDIER #2
line: Get down, get down!

speaker: SOLDIER #1
line: Come on!

speaker: CSM
line: I want to know where Mulder is!

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: I don't know.

speaker: CSM
line: His car's parked outside! He was here! I want Mulder and I want those files!

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: You will find nothing here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened?

speaker: HOSTEEN
line: There were men.

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: They were looking for your partner.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where is he? Mulder!

speaker: MALE TROOPER
line: Out of the car! Come on! Hands on top, spread your legs!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where's Agent Mulder?

speaker: MALE TROOPER
line: Turn and face away! Where are the files?

speaker: SCULLY
line: In the trunk.

speaker: MALE TROOPER
line: We need the DAT copy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't have it!

speaker: MALE TROOPER
line: Who has it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Mulder.

speaker: MALE TROOPER
line: Let's go!

speaker: MAN
line: It is the recommendation of the office of professional conduct that Special Agent Dana Scully be given a mandatory leave of absence until the full detail of her misconduct can be calculated. This summary action is justified under the O.P.C. articles of review and Agent Scully will complete her suspension of duty without pay or benefits, due to the nature of her insubordination and the direct disobedience of her superior agents. We will have to ask that you check your weapon and your badge before you leave the building, Agent Scully.

speaker: SKINNER
line: We would also ask that you make yourself available to answer further questions in our investigation into Agent Mulder's whereabouts.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I've told you everything I know. To the best of my knowledge, Agent Mulder is dead.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Don't think this hasn't been difficult for everyone. Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who are these people?

speaker: SKINNER
line: These people are doing their job.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What they're doing is putting an official stamp on the perpetuation of a lie.

speaker: SKINNER
line: These people have a protocol to follow, which is something you and Agent Mulder did not do.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What about the people who were poisoning Agent Mulder's water? Whose protocol was that?

speaker: SKINNER
line: The investigation will...

speaker: SCULLY
line: The investigation will be an exercise! The men who killed Agent Mulder, the people who killed his father, they aren't meant to be found.

speaker: SKINNER
line: We will find them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: With all due respect, sir, I think you overestimate your position in the chain of command.

speaker: 1ST ELDER
line: Where were the safeguards against this? These files were never meant to be seen.

speaker: 2ND ELDER
line: Forty years of work... the damage could be incalculable.

speaker: 3RD ELDER
line: The damage is done.

speaker: CSM
line: Gentlemen... we have control. The files have been recovered and the men involved in their theft have been removed without incident. There is a small matter of concern with the F.B.I. but we'll handle that internally as usual. The media attention will amount to nothing more than a few, uh, scattered obituaries.

speaker: 1ST ELDER
line: The Mulder problem...

speaker: CSM
line: Special Agent Mulder is dead. His body will not be recovered. He will officially be listed as missing until the matter can be resolved quietly.

speaker: 1ST ELDER
line: And we've recovered the copy of the stolen computer files?

speaker: CSM
line: Yes.

speaker: 1ST ELDER
line: Then all the pertinent parties should be informed that we can continue with our work.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Dana, wh...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi, mom.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: What did you do with your shoes?

speaker: SCULLY
line: They, uh, they started to give me blisters s, so...

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: You walked here at this time of night?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, mom...

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: What is it, Dana?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I've made a terrible mistake. Dad would be so ashamed of me.

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: The men who had come and threatened us did not return to our house again but the following day... Some of the boys from the reservation came to tell us they had seen buzzards flying out near the quarry where Eric had first encountered the men. The buzzard is a large but cowardly bird. It does not work for its prey, letting others provide the kill. When I see them circling in the desert, this can only mean that something has died and they are going to pick its bones... or that death is close and they are waiting for it to do its work for them. We did not see what they saw but I remembered something I had seen as a younger man. Just as my grandson had done, I, too, had found a body at the quarry in a hole, half-buried under rocks, but the buzzards, who will eat anything, would not touch it. This spot is where we found what the buzzards had come for. We could not tell at first who or what it was but I knew what the buzzards knew... that the smell of death was upon it. The desert does not forgive man his weakness. Weak or strong, it takes no mercy and can kill a man in less than a day. To survive, one must develop skin like leather, know where to find water and when to take shelter. The F.B.I. man would have surely died had he not stayed underground, protected like the jackrabbit or the fox. Even so, death was near. In accordance with our ancient traditions, we put for twigs on the beams of the hogan to summon the holy people and tell them that a ceremony will be held. It is called "The Blessing Way" chant. Only the holy people can save the F.B.I. man's life now. He is in their hands.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Frohike?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: I know it's late but I heard the news. Maybe I should go. Pardon my presumptuousness.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How much have you had to drink?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Do you recycle? He was a good friend. A redwood among sprouts. I guess this means he's passing you the torch.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, I'm afraid not. I'm soon to be out of a job.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Those sons of bitches. They're rigging the game.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And like rats, they just scatter back into the woodpile.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: The rats that killed the cat.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's this?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: A news item about Kenneth Soona, a.k.a. "The Thinker." The man who hacked the MJ files. The ones he gave to Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: "Kenneth J. Soona was killed execution style in what appears to be a professional murder. His body found in the Trenton City landfill." What's the date on this? This was the day before yesterday. This is after Mulder disappeared. Could they be so stupid?

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: This healing ritual called "The Blessing Way" has been passed down by our ancient Navajo ancestors. Its songs and prayers must be followed just as they have been for centuries or the holy people will not be summoned. I watched my father perform the chants as a young boy and saw their healing magic. But my fear for the F.B.I. man was that his spirit did not want to be healed. That it wished to join the spirit of his own father who had died and did not want to return to the world of the living. His body has become tired and weak and it searches for rest. If the struggle to continue is too hard or the wish to join his ancestors too strong, the body will give up but if the desire to resume life burns brightly enough, the holy people will be merciful. The days and nights now will be long and difficult for the F.B.I. man has the holy people come and help him to choose.

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: I was first struck by the absence of time, having depended on it so completely as a measure of myself and my life. Moving backwards into the perpetual night that consumes purpose and deed, all passion and will. I come to you, old friend, with the dull clarity of the dead not to beckon you but to feel the fire and intensity that still live in you... and the heavy weight of your burdens which I had once borne. There is truth here, old friend, if that's all you seek but there's no justice or judgment without which truth is a vast, dead hollow. Go back. Do not look into the abyss or let the abyss look into you. Awaken the sleep of reason and fight the monsters within and without.

speaker: HYBRID
line: Help me, please! Let me out! Please, let me out!

speaker: WILLIAM MULDER
line: Hello, son. I did not dare hope to see you so soon nor ever again hope to broker fate with a life to which I gave life. The lies I told you were a pox and poison to my soul and now you are here because of them. Lies I thought might bury forever a truth I could not live with. I stand here, ashamed of the choices I made so long ago, when you were just a boy. You are the memory, Fox. It lives in you. If you were to die now, the truth will die. And only the lies survive us.

speaker: MULDER
line: My sister? Is she here?

speaker: WILLIAM MULDER
line: No. The thing that would destroy me, the truth I felt you must never learn is the truth you will find if you are to go forward.

speaker: TOUR GUIDE
line: Okay, I just need everyone to step through the metal detector and we'll begin the tour. The facility you're in is called the J. Edgar Hoover Building. It was finished in 1974 and built on the site of the original F.B.I. building. We'll also see a display on the ten most wanted, you might see a few of your relatives there. Uh, if you have any questions, feel free to ask and I'll do my best to answer them.

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: Making you come in the front door these days, are they, Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: For now.

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: Are you carrying your weapon?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No.

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: Sorry to have to you run you through this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's okay. That was weird.

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: Yeah, well, I've had a straight pin left in a shirt collar set this machine off but, uh, you can go on through.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Scully, come in, please. You said you needed to see me concerning the investigation?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, sir. I came across a news article. A man's body was found in New Jersey and I have reason to believe that he was killed by the same man responsible for Agent Mulder.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Can I see it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The date of death postdates Agent Mulder's disappearance. Now, you already have the ballistics data from Agent Mulder's father on file. I would like you to run it against the ballistics from this man's case.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Trying to prove what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, if both men were killed by the same weapon, we could prove that Agent Mulder didn't kill his father and it could also help us find the man who did.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You've been relieved of your investigative function.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, I know that, sir. I just thought this might be helpful.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm afraid not. This case would have been handled by the Trenton P.D. They're on our drugfire ballistics database. If there was a match in the two slugs, all the bells and whistles would have gone off by now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You don't want to check?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Miss Scully, I think you underestimate the duties and responsibilities of my position as assistant director.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was just trying to cooperate with your investigation, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: To mitigate your situation and then add to your chances of reinstatement, isn't that right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. I just want answers.

speaker: SKINNER
line: And so do I. I want to know why I was asked to execute a search warrant on your apartment to look for a digital cassette.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't have it.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Is this tape what Agent Mulder died for?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I believe so.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You want to bring me a smoking gun, Scully? You bring me this tape. Otherwise, I would ask you to go home, sit tight and let us do our job.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is that all, sir?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yes, that's all.

speaker: CSM
line: Did you ask her about the tape?

speaker: SKINNER
line: She says she doesn't have it.

speaker: CSM
line: Is that what she says?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yes, that's what she says.

speaker: CSM
line: Well, that's unfortunate for everyone.

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: Back again?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm just curious about something, would you mind if I went through here again?

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: Come on through. This thing is more sensitive than a toothache.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Would you mind running the wand over me one more time?

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: Sure. You wearing a necklace or something?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, not today.

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: Then what the hell is that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you think it could be?

speaker: DOCTOR
line: I don't know. It's embedded in your soft tissue here. Looks like maybe a piece of buckshot or something.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know how it could have gotten there.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: I can feel it just under the skin. And now that I'm looking at it closely, there's a tiny little scar over it. If you want, I could, uh, do a local and pull it out of there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. Thanks for coming down here and doing this for me so late.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: No problem. You were probably wounded in the line of duty and you didn't even know it.

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: For three days, the Blessing Way chant was performed. The F.B.I. man suffered great fevers and his body burned like fire. There was doubt that he recover but the spirits were in attendance because on the night of the third day, he opened his eyes and asked for water. The ritual bath must be given outside the hogan before sunrise. The F.B.I. man was weak from his journey and did not wish to speak but like a rising sun, I sensed in him a rebirth. Still, it will take time to regain his strength.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Well... it's definitely not buckshot. I, uh... I know what it looks like to me but, uh... I couldn't tell you how it got there. Take a look.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It looks like a computer chip.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: That's what it looks like.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't even know how long its been in there. I have absolutely no recollection of it being put there.

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: That is frightening. Dana, this is very serious. You've got to find out what this is.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't have access to the F.B.I. labs.

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: No, I'm, I'm talking about access to your own memory.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hmmm...

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: I mean, obviously, you have buried this so deeply, you can't consciously recall it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Melissa...

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: I know someone, someone who can help you...

speaker: SCULLY
line: No!

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: What are you so afraid of, Dana? You afraid you might actually learn something about yourself? I mean, you are so, you are so shut off to the possibility there could be any other explanation except for your rigid scientific view of the world. It's like you've lost all touch with your own intuition. You're carrying so much grief and fear that you can't see you, you've built up these walls around your true feelings and the memory of what really happened. Just do this for me. As your sister. Please.

speaker: MARK POMERANTZ
line: What I'm going to do is induce an non-ordinary state, a modified form of hypnosis which involves what is called holotropic breath work. This will quiet your interpretive mind so that we can cut through the interference with your memories and perceptions. Now, what I want you to do is to maintain a focus on your breath... relax your breathing. Now, I want you to close your eyes and think of a place where you've always felt completely comfortable and safe. You told me of your experience of being taken away and losing time. Do you remember how you felt just before this happened?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was afraid...

speaker: MARK POMERANTZ
line: Do you remember what you were afraid of?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Um... that I would die...

speaker: MARK POMERANTZ
line: But you didn't die. Someone must have cared for you. Do you remember who that someone was?

speaker: SCULLY
line: There were men... um, a man took me and, uh... there was a light and... loud sounds, my, um... my ears were pounding.

speaker: MARK POMERANTZ
line: They performed a procedure on you. Do you remember any pain during this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm trying. The, the sound is all screwed up. There was an alarm. Th, I remember, um... they wanted to know if I was all right.

speaker: MARK POMERANTZ
line: Maybe you trusted them not to hurt you. Could this be possible?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know.

speaker: MARK POMERANTZ
line: At the F.B.I., you work with people you must entrust with your life. Could it have been one of these people?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I had to trust someone... I was powerless. I couldn't... I could not resist them.

speaker: MARK POMERANTZ
line: If this is too painful, I want you to go back to that comfortable place where we began and try again.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No! I'm sorry... I'm trying, I'm trying. I don't think this is working. I don't think we're getting anywhere. Thank you, but you'll have to excuse me.

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: You must be careful now to end the ceremony properly. If you leave, you must not do any work, change clothes or bathe for four days.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's really going to cut into my social life.

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: The boys have a gift for you. You asked for them during your worst fevers.

speaker: MULDER
line: During my fever, I... I left here and traveled to a place.

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: This place. You carry it with you. It is inside of you. It is the origin place.

speaker: MULDER
line: It wasn't a dream?

speaker: ALBERT HOSTEEN
line: Yes. We are done now.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Skinner.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You came to see me today.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Excuse me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You came to my apartment, I assumed you wanted to see me about something.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I don't know what you're talking about.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I saw you come out of my building.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You've obviously made a mistake, I'm sorry. I need some air. Excuse me.

speaker: MULDER
line: I have been on the bridge that spans two worlds, the link between all souls by which we cross into our own true nature. You were here today, looking for truth that was taken from you, a truth that was never to be spoken but which now binds us together in dangerous purpose. I have returned from the dead to continue with you... but I fear that this danger is now close at hand... that I may be too late.

speaker: PRIEST
line: So we are here to mourn the passing of William Mulder, to join in our grief for our loss but to share also the memories of a man whose life was rich and full and who made his family's and his friends' lives richer and fuller as well. Sadly, I've been informed today by the mother of William's children that his son, Fox, could not be here to join us in this time of sorrow.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mrs. Mulder?

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Yes?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm Dana Scully, I work with your son. Um... I know what you may have heard from the F.B.I. but I have a very strong feeling that your son is going to be found.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Oh, my goodness gracious.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think he's still alive.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: How do you know?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just have a very strong feeling. I promise I'll let you know as soon as I do.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Thank you. Thank you very much.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Hello. I see you're a friend of the family. So am I. Do you think we might find a moment to speak?

speaker: SCULLY
line: About?

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: A very serious matter. Please... can we find someplace away from the others? I couldn't help overhearing your conversation. You think the son is still alive?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who are you?

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: I'm a member of a kind of consortium. We represent certain global interests.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What kind of interests?

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Interests that would be extremely threatened by the digital tape that you are no longer in possession of.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Threatened enough to murder?

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Oh, my, yes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you know about Mulder?

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: That he is dead. Cui bono.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're lying.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: I'm not here to tell you lies.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you here for?

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: To tell you your life is in danger too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Leave me alone.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: They'll kill you one of two ways. They'll send someone, possibly two men. They'll kill you in your home or in the garage with an unregistered weapon which will be left at the scene. Using false documents supplied by associates of mine, they'll be out of the country in less than two hours.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You said there were two ways.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Yes. He or she will be someone close to you. Someone you trust. They'll arrange a meeting or come to your house unexpectedly. Do you have someplace else you might stay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why, why kill me?

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: You want something they don't. Justice. And because they are now quite certain you don't have the computer copy of the files they're looking for.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why are you protecting me?

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: I feel my colleagues are acting... impulsively and your death will draw unnecessary attention to our group.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're not protecting me, you're protecting yourself.

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: Why should that surprise you? Motives are rarely unselfish.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What kind of business are you in?

speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
line: We predict the future and the best way to predict the future is to invent it. Good day, young lady.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mom?

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Oh... my God! Oh, Fox. I can't believe it. I expected the worst.

speaker: MULDER
line: I need your help, Mom, but I don't have much time.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: They said something terrible has happened to you.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm okay but I need your help. I need you to remember.

speaker: MULDER
line: I need to know more about Dad. Who these people are.

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: It was all so long ago.

speaker: MULDER
line: I need you to try and remember, Mom. These pictures were taken in 1972. Where?

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: I don't know.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dad was working for the state department, he'd go on the road. Where would he go?

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: I don't remember, Fox. Please...

speaker: MULDER
line: Will you look at the pictures, Mom?

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Don't do this...

speaker: MULDER
line: Just look at them!

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Don't do this to me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Now, he must have talked about his work, about the men he worked with. Did he ever bring them home? Were they ever here?

speaker: MRS. MULDER
line: Yes... but I don't remember their names anymore. What does this have to do with, Fox?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think it has to do with Samantha. I think it has to do with what happened to my sister.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello?

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: Dana? It's your sister.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi.

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: Hi, where've you been?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I, uh, I had to go to Boston... for a funeral.

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: Oh, well, I was worried about you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why?

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: Because I haven't heard from you since you saw Doctor Pomerantz.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Missy, something strange happened to me today. I'm... I'm a bit freaked out by it.

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: Okay, well, I, I want to come over. I want to talk to you. Are you going to be there for a while?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, yeah, I will.

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: Okay.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Bye.

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY
line: I'll see you in a bit.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi. Come on, come on, come on...

speaker: MELISSA SCULLY ON MACHINE
line: Hi, this is Melissa. I'm very sorry that I missed your call. Please leave a message and I'll call you back, okay? Have a really nice day.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Missy, it's me. Please pick up. Missy? Missy, pick up... I'm coming over to your place instead. I'll, I'll, uh, I'll look for you on the way. Bye.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Scully, get in the car. I need to talk to you, it's very important.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was just going over to my sister's.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'll drop you by there, right now, I need for you to come with me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are we going?

speaker: SKINNER
line: To a place we can talk in private.

speaker: SCULLY
line: After you. Eyes forward. Put your hands where I can see them. Don't turn around or I'll blow your head off. Don't think I won't do it, you son of a bitch.

speaker: SKINNER
line: No, I believe you. Just stay cool, I'm with you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Take two steps forward. Now move slowly towards the couch. Turn around and sit down on your hands.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Are you going to let me tell you why I'm here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know why you're here. I want to know who sent you. Whose errand boy you are.

speaker: SKINNER
line: No one sent me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You got the rest of your life to give me answers.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Oh, no. Oh, damn it.

speaker: HISPANIC MAN
line: What's wrong?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Let's... let's get out of here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How high does it go, Skinner? Who's pulling the strings?

speaker: SKINNER
line: You can kill me, Scully, but you'll only be doing their work for them. Forget about your job and family. You'll spend the rest of your life behind bars, there isn't a federal judge that they couldn't persuade.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's the alternative? Let you kill me now?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I didn't come here to kill you. I came here to give you something. I've got the digital tape.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're lying.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I've got it in my pocket. I took it out of Mulder's desk.
